Hello Bill,

I've been using such a project structure successfully since I =
first tried
Eclipse.  I mark both src/java and src/test as source folders v=
ia the
project properties dialog.  Alternately, you can right click on the =
project
and create new source folders whose root is src/java and src/test. =
 Then
right click on the src/java folder and create a package named a.b.c a=
nd
Eclipse will create the folder structure for you under src/java; repeat =
for
src/test.  Note, all of this applies to the Package Explorer view of th=
e
Java perspective.

Good luck,
Craig
